page.title: 02WEST HUNTINGTOWER (2)
page.content: Residents find the noise disturbing, as traffic uses nearby country roads as a short cut from the A9 South to the A9 North. A new Western bypass, opening in September 1985, five months ahead of plan will take much of this traffic. Huntingtower Quarry, sometimes called the Hermitage, is being filled in by King and Company Ltd. It will take between twenty and twenty five years. The water, polluted and green, is not clear. Two mallard ducks were observed. There is a small upholstery buisness in the village. It has been operational for twenty years and work is constant. The one man owner set up in West Huntingtower in order to be independent.
